intro: Psychotria samoritourei, commonly known as the Samorito psychotria, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the rainforests of Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and small, clustered white flowers. It typically grows as an understory plant, thriving in the humid and shaded conditions of the forest floor. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
